version_description:
Home and work can now be saved in your Favorites. Add the addresses and quickly plan your commutes according to the current traffic conditions. To set your home and work addresses, please log in to your account. Logging in ensures that your favorites are backed up and synced between devices.

Do you get around the city by minibus, or do you have a travel card and prefer regular city buses? You can choose your favourite public transport types with the new transport filters option!

We have finished company messaging. Now we will send you a push notification as soon as a company answers you, even if the app is not open. Make sure that your notifications are active in the system settings (iPhone settings > Notifications > 2GIS > Turn on “notification access”).

Did you know that you can easily message companies through 2GIS? Open the company card, click the “Message” button in the panel and a chat will open.

If you like 2GIS we would be grateful to receive a review on the App Store. Your review will help others find 2GIS and will give them access to accurate information about their city.
If you have any difficulties we would be glad to help you. Please write to us at ios4@2gis.ru (you can message us directly from the app)

Home improvement never stops! But hey, we’re in it together. From now on, 2GIS app can search for tools and construction supplies and display the prices right on the city map.

Just type a name of a drill or a faucet model in the search bar and choose where to buy it cheaper or closer to home. You can also open a card of a DIY store, go to the Prices tab and check out its catalogue before going shopping.

By the way, it’s not only about home improvement: you can also search for tires, and it’s about time to do that, too. More categories are coming soon.

The products search in 2GIS saves time and money. It really does! Check it out.

Never miss your stop again!

Introducing a new alarm for public transit rides. Turn it on, so 2GIS can let you know when you have to get off.
To set an alarm, build a route and tap “Remind me to get off”. You’ll get a push-notification even if you leave the app.

Note that the feature is only available for ground transportation. It can’t track your location while on the subway.

Now the Navigator is finally running in the background! You can minimize the app or turn off the screen, and it will continue guiding you along the route and giving voice directions.

Create a route right on the map and the app will show you the time and distance information next to the route lines. It is now more convenient to compare routes.

It is now even more convenient to use the search results on the map: you will see the companies that are closed at the moment displayed as gray markers (the open ones are still blue).

And yes, we have fixed the issue causing 2GIS blocking on the phone when connecting it to CarPlay. Now, if you do not explicitly run 2GIS on the head unit, you can safely use the app on your phone.

2GIS speaking! We've got updates. Most are solely technical, but here are the most prominent ones:

- Traffic alerts got captions. Now you can see on the map a road closure schedule or on which lane there's an accident.
- Brought back the option to add a business to your contacts. As you requested. Go ahead and add the number of your favourite bakery right to your phone book.
- Search results got a makeover and now look fresh and fancy. Check them out!
- Now we display movement direction on Apple Watch for you to always stay on course.
- In CarPlay, there are now sound signals at the beginning and the end of voice input. For your convenience!
- Now you can report errors in the navigator with a long tap. If something's wrong — let us know.
